newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT-Coelce begun as a buy.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-Coelce begun as a buy.

text.p: -- Caspian Securities said in a report it was initiating coverage of Brazilian electricity distributor Coelce, owned by the northeastern state of Ceara, with a buy rating.
-- It said Coelce was "inexpensive" on an enterprise-value basis, noting that the firm returned to profitability in 1996 after eight years of losses.
-- The report said Ceara was mulling either the privatization of the firm or the sale of a minority stake in the firm to a strategic operator.
-- Caspian set a 12-month target price for the firm of 5.60 reais per 1,000 shares for a return of 45 percent if the company is not privatized.
-- If it is sold off, the brokerage forecasts a 12-month target price of 8.81 reais per 1,000 stock, representing a 129 percent return on equity.

-- "In 1997, we expect Coelce to post net income of 24.8 million reais, or 0.17 reais per 1,000 shares, a 422 percent increase over 1996, and to begin paying the minimum 25 percent dividend on adjusted net income," it said.
-- Coelce's preferred A shares, the company's most liquid stock, traded at 4.05 reais, up 8 percent.
